result.execSummary:
The defendant Monte Solomon Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Monte Solomon Lee is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Monte Solomon Lee was found guilty of Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).
  • Monte Solomon Lee was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: Restitution set at $0.  
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge. Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to the revocation sentence defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of extended supervision.
Pay all supervision fees .

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Monte Solomon Lee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (29 pages) commencing MARCH 17, 2016 received and filed.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court amends the Information to reflect the proper named victim in COUNT 5.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to the revocation sentence defendant is currently serving. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEARS, concurrent with COUNT 3. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at $0  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored. 

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
NOTICE OF MOTION , RECEIVED AND FILED
Defense alternative presentence investigation report received and filed.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 4 DISMISSED.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charges in COUNTS 3 and 5.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.   Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information received and filed.  COUNT 5 is amended to Operating a Motor Vehicle Without Owners Consent pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 943.23(3), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony and COUNT 3 amended to Possession of a Firearm - Adjudged Delinquent - As a Party to a Crime, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 941.29(2)(b), 939.50(3)(g), 939.05, a Class G Felony.  Court modifies Amended Information to correct the location of the offense and the vehicle involved in this offense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Monte Solomon Lee not in court, in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared  for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Attorney Harris appears as new counsel.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for Ron Dague the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Attorney Kies informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  On both parties request Court grants an adjournment.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Branch 19 is in jury trial on another case.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jean M. Kies in court, defendant Monte Solomon Lee not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Certified records filed.  Case adjourned to Br.22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Megan Carmody for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Arraignment scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tri City National Bank; Kara G. or Co-Defendant Justin Jacobs-Wright

Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Monte Solomon Lee in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
